instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image or back-light
threads.message:
have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and had very minor liquid on u 8300 and mostly on <CAPACITOR>C8352</CAPACITOR> pin 2, 

is this a GPU issue, i seen it pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C8352</CAPACITOR> goes to the GPU,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image or back-light
threads.message:
There is no dedicated GPU.
Mentioned line goes to CPU.

Do you get chime and USB activity?

Check if you get voltage on L8300; there must be 5V in the first 1-2s, even without LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image or back-light
threads.message:
there is image and it works perfectly on external display, 

also i do have 5V on L8300

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image or back-light
threads.message: Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>; with internal LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image or back-light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image or back-light
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> 0.0v"
PCH cannot detect the LCD in this case.
You must check this signal when 5V is present at L8300.
Try known good LCD assembly; be aware of year compatibility.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image or back-light
threads.message:
i checked <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> while a known working display connected and also known year to be compatible.

also yes, i checked L8300 having 5v while testing <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image or back-light
threads.message: sent it back, could not figure it our
